result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel J. O'Keefe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Daniel J. O'Keefe is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Daniel J. O'Keefe was found guilty of Kidnapping/Seize or Confine w/o Consent [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Penalties for Felonies-Class "C" Felony], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.31(1)(b).
  • Daniel J. O'Keefe was found guilty of 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Penalties for Felonies-Class "F" Felony], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).
  • Daniel J. O'Keefe was found guilty of Sell/Deliver/Possess Firearm Silencer [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.298(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
***AMENDED****
Days credit.

-Consecutive to Count 3.
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.


-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Consecutive to: Count 3

superMiscConds.notes:
***AMENDED****
Per Judge Scott R. Needham signed Order May 9, 2016.

$1735.12 restitution to be collected out of prison wages at rate 25% pursuant to Wis. Stat. 303.01(8)(b).

$268.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF254.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF254.
Not to possess any weapons or firearms.

-NO CONTACT whatsoever with K.M.D., her family, residence or work place.
-Defendant to follow any mental and psychological health treatment program.
-Follow any programming as recommended by the Agent.
-Defendant to submit a DNA sample.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes DF ATTY: Brian Thomas Smestad DF: Daniel J. O'Keefe appeared from jail. Case called at 2:38. Court reviews file, charges and pleadings. PSI has been completed. Atty. Smestad has provided a portion of a psychological evaluation pages 8-11. Also included are articles on sleep deprivation and an article on hypoglycemia. Atty. Smestad reviews inaccuracies  in PSI. ADA Nieskes updates the court and makes sentencing recommendations. Victim makes a statement. Atty. Smestad makes sentencing recommendations. DE makes statment.

Conditions of extended supervision:
- DE to have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, KMD, family, residence or work place.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.
- DE to follow any mental and psychological health treatment program. 
- Not to possess any weapons or firearms.
- Follow any other programming recommended by the agent. 
- Costs
-DNA surcharge
- Submit DNA sample 
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times.

DE is not eligible for for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 

Restitution to be determined within 10 days. 
DE is remanded.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson.ADA:  Matthew Hartung  DF ATTY: Brian Thomas Smestad DF: Daniel J. O'Keefe appeared from jail. Case called at 9:01. Atty. Smestad updates the court as the the silencer charge.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1, 3 and 6  in 15CF254. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1, 3 and 6 in 15CF254. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses with prejudice Ct 2, 4, 5, 7, 8, and 9 in 15CF254. Court orders a PSI, Atty. Smestad notified the Court that his office will be conducting an independant PSI as well. Court revokes bail and DE is remanded. DE mother would like her apt. key, storage unit key and post office box key. Court authorizes the State to release those keys to DE mother.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Plea hearing at 12-14-2015 09:00 am

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA:  Matthew L Hartung  DF ATTY: Brian Thomas Smestad DF:  Daniel J. O'Keefe appeared from jail. Case called at 4:03. Court reviews file. Atty. Smestad updates the court. DE will waive today.  Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. ADA Hartung updates the court, there may be additional charges. Bond continues in form and amount.  Arraignment scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Atty Smestad
15SW103 executed on 6/4/15. Signed by EFV on 6/4/15 with Application and Affffidavit. Filed in 15CF254
Preliminary hearing on June 9, 2015 at 04:00 pm.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, with the initials KMD.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- If DE bonds out DE to check in with St. Croix County jail daily and update his address with the jail staff. 

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

Apprs: Commissioner Heckmann for CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Matthew L Hartung DF ATTY: Brian Thomas Smestad DF: Daniel J. O'Keefe appeared from jail. Smestad is now the atty. on file.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 04:00 pm.
